body: LEAD: There is little doubt that the deep slump in demand for offices and high-priced apartments has caught New York City real estate developers off guard, but different developers have been stung in different ways. While many are struggling with too much space and too few tenants, not all face the gargantuan financial pressures looming over Donald
title: New York Developers Feel a Chill

body: LEAD: Federal regulators, fresh from their experience taking over distressed property elsewhere in the nation, are facing new legal challenges and deep resentment as they move into the troubled market for New York area cooperative apartments. title: U.S. Bank Regulators Challenged By the Co-op Market in New York

body: LEAD: Kitty Carlisle Hart, chairwoman of the New York State Council on the Arts, told Pratt Institute's class of 1990 yesterday that the freedom of artistic expression is at risk because of ignorance, and she urged the graduates to ''defend the right of all of us to say and do what we wish and fight the ignorance. title: COMMENCEMENTS; Pratt Institute

title: Fairs and Festivals This Weekend

body: LEAD: In June, house tour devotees have a choice of visiting historic house museums scattered in the city's five boroughs, Victorian brownstones in Brooklyn, a mansion in Yonkers and 19th-century houses in Roslyn, L.I. There are also a garden tour and a show house in Connecticut. In June, house tour devotees have a choice of visiting historic house
title: June Arriving With House Tours Galore

body: LEAD: When historic district designation comes to a neighborhood, some developers run the other way in fear of the restrictions imposed by the protective recognition. But the builder of a condominium project now under way in Brooklyn was not deterred when the city's Landmarks Preservation Commission included in the Clinton When historic district
title: Postings: Building in a Historic District; 11 Condo Rowhouses for Clinton Hill

body: LEAD: Twenty-five years ago, New York City made a formal commitment to protect its architectural heritage. Since Mayor Robert F. Wagner signed the Landmarks Preservation Law on April 19, 1965, 53 historic districts have been created, and more than 900 buildings or interiors have been given landmark status. Twenty-five years ago, New York City made
title: City Landmark Tours Celebrate Preservation

body: LEAD: A turn-of-the-century terra cotta-and-brick apartment house in the Clinton Hill Historic District of Brooklyn has undergone a total renovation into eight modern duplex condominium apartments. The project, at 201 St. James Place between Gates Avenue and Fulton Street, is in an area noted for its architecturally distinctive neo-Renaissance
title: POSTINGS: Clinton Hill Renovation; 8 Duplex Condos
